Welcome to my Portfolio!

Get to know me through my projects:

Projects:

QuadBox Controllers

Built using React Three Fiber, users can customize and build their own fight-stick style controller, and then purchase their customized creation. The 3d model of the controller updates dynamically so that the user can create a controller personalized to them. Routing is done using React Router.

This project was my first time using both React-Three-Fiber and React Router, it served as a rewarding learning experience. I hadn't used Three.js yet either at the time, so jumping straight to React-Three-Fiber provided an enticing challenge. I also decided to learn Zustand and utilize it over redux for this project as it uses less boilerplate and is well suited for a project of this size.

Doggogram

An Instagram clone where users can only post photos of dogs. This site utilizes machine learning to verify that posts include a dog before the user posts. Built using NextJS, it has the core features of Instagram including user authentification through nextAuth, posting, commenting, liking and a UI that mirror's Instagram's. Utilizes Tensorflow for the dog image recognition. Hosted with vercel, uses firebase for backend to store posts data.

Building a website based on a pre-existing site served as an excellent way to practice my CSS skills and bolster my understanding of NextJS. This was also an exciting way to learn more about machine learning modules.

Twitter Clone

Twitter Clone built using React. Utilizes firebase for hosting and Tailwind CSS to mimic the look and feel of twitter. Users can post tweets with or without images.

This project served as a valuable way to hone my css tailwind and flexbox skills. It was also my first time using vercel for hosting and storing backend data on firebase.

Bopify:A Spotify Clone

A spotify clone that includes core features of spotify, and functions as a remote web player. Simply log in and control your spotify being played from another device. Please note that you must have another instance of spotify open, the site cannot play spotify music directly as this violates the developer rules set by Spotify in order to use their API, it can however serve as a remote controller for your Spotify. Created Using NextJS and Spotify's context API. Cross browser compatibility, and utilizes NextAuthfor authentification.

About Me:

When I'm not on my computer working away, you can find me playing soccer, 3d modeling and 3d printing, or putting together and flying racing drones. I've always had an affinity for tech and computers so web development has provided me an excellent medium to learn and grow.
